intro: Matayba guianensis f. livescens, commonly known as the Guianese matayba, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of study in ecological research.
